general.translation[0].definitions[0].de: describing or relating to only the main features or parts of something, not the details
general.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: I skimmed through it to get a general impression of the text.
I have a general idea of what I want to express.
He spoke in general terms about greater competitiveness.
general.translation[0].definitions[1].de: involving the whole of a situation, group, or thing, rather than specific parts of it
general.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: There has been a general decline in standards.
ways to improve your general health
general.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: I hate paperwork as a general rule.
general.translation[0].definitions[3].de: shared by or affecting most people, or most of the people in a group
general.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: These courses are based around topics of general interest.
How soon can the drug be made available for general use?
general.translation[0].definitions[4].de: not limited to one use, activity, subject etc
general.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: The next ten minutes passed in general conversation.
This type of microphone is suitable for general use.
general.translation[0].definitions[5].de: used to talk about an approximate area or direction
general.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: Pat and his friend were in the general area of the crime when it happened.
They started walking in the general direction of the pub.
general.translation[0].definitions[6].de: used in the name of a job to show that the person who does it has complete responsibility
general.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: in general
used when saying that something is usually true in most situations, or about most people or things
In general, temporary jobs are less well-paid.
In general, the bigger a company becomes, the harder it is to maintain customer satisfaction.
generally
another way of saying ‘in general’, which is often used before a verb. Generally can also be used to say that most people have a particular opinion
Women generally live longer than men.
Newton is generally regarded as the father of modern science.
generally speaking/as a rule
other ways of saying ‘in general’
Generally speaking, large breeds of dog are becoming less popular.
He’s a singer who doesn’t do interviews, as a rule.
The graduates are, generally speaking, a confident and articulate group of young people.
mostly/mainly/largely
used when saying that something is true about most people or things, or about most of something. Largely is slightly more formal than mostly or mainly
The disease mainly affects women.
Their attempts were largely unsuccessful.
The students were mostly French and German, but there were a few Japanese students too.
for the most part
used when saying that something is true in most cases, but not in every case
These problems have for the most part been resolved.
For the most part, the gangs were made up of boys aged between 11 and 16.
by and large/on the whole
used for saying that something is true in most ways or in most cases
The project was, by and large, a success.
On the whole, people were very friendly.
general.translation[1].definitions[0].de: an officer of very high rank in the army or air force
